citations.narrative:
Several of the dog enclosures had an excessive buildup of debris and grime on the doors and walls. There was areas of
rust observed on the bottom of several of the chain link metal enclosure doors. In addition, a birds nest was observed in
the rack on a wall in one of the enclosures. A collection of clutter was observed, as well an overall layer of dust through
the area. These conditions can affect the health and wellbeing of the dogs and could possibly lead to illness. Cleaning of
surfaces and areas in housing facilities must be performed as often as necessary to satisfy generally accepted standards
and husbandry.
******Correct by Sep 15, 2023

The food storage area where food is stored for the dogs has bottles of chemicals and collections of maintenance tools.
Storage of chemicals adjacent to food items can potentially lead to contamination and affect the wholesomeness of the
food and potentially cause illness to the dogs. Substances which are toxic to the dogs but are required for normal
husbandry practices must not be stored in food storage and preparation areas but may be stored in cabinets in the
animals areas. The facility needs to correct this issue.
********Correct by Sep. 15, 2023

1. Areas of the chain link fencing for the enclosure housing the alpacas was observed to be significantly sagging
downward. The vertical metal support pole was no longer upright, but was splayed outward thus not maintaining the chain
link wire vertically in that area.
2. A tree had fallen during one of the recent storms and had landed on a section of chain link fencing for an enclosure
which housed an alpaca. At the time of inspection the section was bent downward, and there were areas of bent, sagging
and jagged wire. The facility had started the clean up process for the tree, however the enclosure fencing had not yet
been repaired.
Enclosures must be maintained in good repair so as to prevent injury to the animals housed within. Outdoor housing
facilities shall be structurally sound in order to contain the animals.
*********Correct by November 1, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
